bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: When editing a console font, fontopia abends leaving keyboard in an unusable state.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): fontopia-1.1-4.fc24.x86_64 terminus-fonts-console-4.40-5.fc24.noarch
How reproducible: Very.
Steps to Reproduce: 1. copy /usr/lib/kbd/consolefonts/ter-124b.psf.gz into a work directory 2. unzip the work ter-124b.psf 3. CTRL-ALT-F2 and login 4. switch to work directory 5. fontopia ter-124b.psf 6. press right-arrow key
Actual results: fontopia abends: Aborted (core dumped) keyboard is now in unusable state machine must be cold booted
Expected results: display of font bits changes from left half of British Pound symbol to right half of British Pound symbol.
Additional info:
fontopia-1.3-1.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-c11733a9ce
fontopia-1.3-1.fc23 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 23. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-98b2471662
fontopia-1.3-1.el6 has been submitted as an update to Fedora EPEL 6. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2016-cf00c28efd

fontopia-1.3-1.el6 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 6 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2016-cf00c28efd
